apps.name: Thunderbird
apps.notes: Mozilla Thunderbird email client. Source is in Mercurial repository at hg.mozilla.org/comm-central/. GitHub mirror may exist but official source is Mercurial. Releases tracked via Mozilla release process.

apps.name: Firefox
apps.notes: Mozilla Firefox web browser. Source is in Mercurial repository at hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/. GitHub mirror may exist but official source is Mercurial. Releases tracked via Mozilla release process.

apps.name: Podman Desktop
apps.notes: Desktop app for managing Podman containers. Part of containers organization.

apps.name: Mission Center
apps.notes: System monitor app similar to Windows Task Manager. Hosted on GitLab.com.

apps.name: Impression
apps.notes: USB image writer tool. Hosted on GitLab.com. Flatpak manifest uses archive releases from project uploads.

methodology: Researched by examining Flathub manifest repositories at github.com/flathub/<app-id>, extracting source URLs from manifest JSON/YAML files, checking README files, and following GNOME naming conventions (apps.gnome.org URLs map to gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/<repo-name>).

specialCases.note: App was renamed from Evince to Papers, but repository name remains evince
Repository is gnome-text-editor, not just text-editor
Uses Mercurial VCS, not Git. Official repo is hg.mozilla.org
Uses Mercurial VCS, not Git. Official repo is hg.mozilla.org
Already had correct GitLab URL in apps.json (gitlab.gnome.org/World/gnome-firmware)
Already had correct GitLab URL in apps.json (gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/sushi)

recommendations: For Phase 3.2 (override/mapping system), create a mapping table that converts apps.gnome.org URLs to gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/<repo> URLs. GNOME apps follow a predictable pattern. For Mozilla apps, consider whether to track Mercurial repos or use alternative release tracking methods (RSS feeds, release pages, etc.).
